Let P be an absolute point of P,  and let Sp be a 2-Sylow subgroup of G contained in Gp.  We have Gp = SpC,  where G is a cyclic group,  for the stabilizer of an absolute points in Tß ( P ) has a normal 2-Sylow subgroup having a complement isomorphic with the multiplicative group of and a normal Sylow subgroup has complements.  Further more all complements of Sp in Gp are conjugate and any element not in Sp is contained in some complement.  If G is not Frobenius then from the above there will be a homology r in Gp and we may suppose т € G ( it is in some conjugate of G ). Thus we have a one-to-one correspondence between the hyperbolic lines through P and the complements of Spin Gp,  and we deduce that Sp is transitive on the hyperbolic lines through P.
